name: Chorizo Stuffed Poblano Peppers
author: jiver
summary: Delicious and easy! Poblanos seemed like a logical choice for kicking stuffed peppers up a notch. We were amazed by how well these turned out. Give them a try! Recipe could easily be doubled or tripled as needed.
ingredients: 2  poblano peppers, halved lengthwise and seeded
2 tablespoons taco sauce, or to taste
directions: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C)
Heat olive oil in a skillet over medium-high heat
Cook and stir chorizo in hot oil until completely browned and broken into small pieces, 7 to 10 minutes
Remove skillet from heat; stir rice, onion, 1/4 cup taco sauce, Cheddar cheese, and cumin with the chorizo until evenly mixed
Fill poblano pepper halves with the chorizo mixture; place in a small casserole dish or a pie pan
Drizzle 1 tablespoon taco sauce over each pepper
Pour water into bottom of the dish; cover loosely with aluminum foil
Bake in preheated oven until peppers are tender, about 1 hour
